body.name: CariFree Maintenance Rinse (Mint): Fluoride Mouthwash | Dentist Recommended Anti-Cavity Oral Care | Xylitol | Neutralizes pH | Freshen Breath | Cavity Prevention | Alcohol Free

features: [WIN THE BATTLE AGAINST TOOTH DECAY]: Do you ever wonder why some of us continue to get cavities despite meticulous oral hygiene, whereas others who rarely brush and floss do not? The risk of cavities varies from person to person and is based on eating and drinking habits, hygiene (brushing and flossing), saliva flow, as well as other factors. *NEW LOOK, same great formula! Formally known as CariFree CTx3 Rinse*

[PROTECT YOUR ENAMEL]: The CariFree Maintenance Rinse contains 0.05% sodium fluoride, which helps prevent tooth decay and white spots. Evidence shows that fluoride strengthens your teeth and aids in the prevention of dental cavities.

[NEUTRALIZE pH] Studies suggest that decay is a function of low pH. Maintaining an elevated or neutral pH balance helps to keep your tooth enamel and smile healthy. The CariFree Maintenance Rinse is alcohol-free and contains patented pH+ technology to elevate the pH in your mouth, keeping it balanced. U.S. Patent No. 9,427,384 & 10,143,633.

[FORMULATED WITH XYLITOL]: The Maintenance Rinse contains 25% xylitol! Xylitol is a naturally occurring, sweet-tasting ingredient found in many types of plants. Research shows that regular use of xylitol-rich products may reduce your risk of dental cavities.

[DENTIST-RECOMMENDED MOUTHWASH] Maintaining proper dental hygiene and cavity prevention is essential to a happy and healthy smile! The dentist recommended Maintenance Rinse fluoride mouthwash actively works to prevent cavities, freshen breath, and elevate pH.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Perfect For Patients with decay or high risk of decay Low/poor saliva Bad breath (halitosis) Moisturizing mouth Product Benefits Long-term cavity prevention Elevated pH Maintain healthy enamel Alcohol-free Non-staining 3 grams of xylitol per dose Available in mint, citrus, and grape! Why CariFree? Break the cycle of decay with CariFree. CariFree's pH elevated products. Safe to use every day, our non-abrasive products are highly effective and scientifically proven to prevent cavities through remineralization.

How To We recommend using the CariFree Maintenance Rinse along with the CariFree Gel 1100. For best results, rinse first, brush second and wait 30 minutes before eating or drinking. Use twice daily Swish for 60 seconds with 10 mL CariFree Gel 1100 replaces your current toothpaste Brush twice daily with a pea-sized amount

Elevated pH Maintaining an elevated or neutral pH balance helps keep your tooth enamel and smile healthy. Xylitol The xylitol in the Maintenance Rinse is a naturally occurring, sweet-tasting ingredient found in many types of plants. Research shows that regular use of xylitol-rich products may reduce your risk of dental cavities. Fluoride Maintenance Rinse is one of CariFree's most popular products due to its great taste and fresh feeling. This scientifically proven formula contains cavity-fighting fluoride, xylitol, and an elevated pH. Maintenance Rinse is non-staining, alcohol-free, and is recommended by dentists for use twice daily and for ages 6+. For best results, we suggest pairing the Maintenance Rinse and the CariFree Gel 1100 - rinsing first and brushing second so that the nanohydroxyapatite in the CariFree Gel 1100 remains on the teeth for additional protection. Elevated pH Xylitol Fluoride

What Makes Us Different? Do you ever wonder why some people continue to get cavities despite meticulous oral hygiene, whereas others who rarely brush and floss do not? Can a person really be cavity-prone? An imbalance in your mouth causes cavities, and when dentists drill and fill cavities, they are only treating the result, not the imbalance itself—and the decay returns. For many, it’s a frustrating, reactive approach to oral health, but not surprising. Until recently, dentists were taught that you'd be free of decay if you have good oral hygiene. The problem is that it’s just not that simple. Break the cycle of decay with CariFree. CariFree's pH-elevated products fix the problem at its source. Safe to use every day, our non-abrasive products are highly effective and scientifically proven to prevent cavities.

Try All Three Flavors! CariFree Maintenance Rinse comes in 3 delicious flavors; try them all! New look same great product! Previously called CTx3 Rinse A daily rinse intended to help maintain long-term oral health by providing anti-cavity benefits, including fluoride and pH neutralization. Recommended for ages 6+. 16 fl oz bottle (approximately 48 doses per bottle)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The rinse before you brush
reviews.reviewText: This rinse makes my mouth feel clean, even before I brush. I use it several times a day. It doesn't burn or make me pucker. I am glad I found this rinse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent if you understand the science behind it.
reviews.reviewText: CariFree offers a carefully thought out line of products geared more earnestly towards improving your oral health than any other company I have encountered. I have rather bad teeth and so am extremely careful with them, and put a lot of effort into finding the best products; therefore I settled on CariFree.There are a number of reasons why this is absolutely superior to ordinary mouthwashes such as those from Crest or Listerine.1) This is alkaline. People often think that your teeth get back because of sugar; this is not the case. The sugar feed bacteria which then metabolize it to produce acid. It is therefore quite obviously desirable to neutralize this acid, which spikes after eating any food but particularly after eating/drinking sugary or acidic drinks (sugar free sweets are often full of acids to give a "sour" flavor). Most mouthwashes are actually acidic, as you can find upon a quick google search; according to Frey Smiles' blog, Listerine is around pH 4 and Crest Pro-Health around 4.7. Neutral is pH 7. CariFree is pH 8.2) This has no alcohol. Alcohol is generally not good for you; it's been linked with oral cancer, and definitely can cause dry mouth. Also, it just feels nasty in your mouth.3) This is antibacterial without staining. Xylitol is a generally effective antimicrobial, antiviral, and antifungal agent. Some studies do say you should not eat xylitol, but this is a rinse, not a gum. The other main antimicrobials are alcohol and cetylpyridinium chloride. Alcohol is bad for the reasons we've mentioned; CPC, on the other hand, can cause awful tooth staining (and it did this for me).4) This has fluoride. Many rinses do not- you have to look carefully on the package. Tooth enamel is a mineral that consists of calcium, phosphate, and hydroxide ions. In solution, as in your saliva, these ions are constantly popping off and on, but at a very low rate (acidity increases this rate, however). Fluoride ions are more electronegative than hydroxide ions, and so they pop back in instead of hydroxide and hold the structure together more tightly (decreasing the rate at which they pop off).In terms of usage, I also enjoy its flavor, and the fact that it isn't full of useless or possibly harmful dyes, scents, or other additives like most other mouthwashes. It's pretty straightforward: a bunch of really important ingredients that work together well. I also might add that although this product is very expensive, it was developed off real science; the likes of Listerine are products that have been sold in forms very similar to their current form for years. CariFree has a hard time competing with these big companies, but they do offer better products.Finally, I'd recommend looking into their remineralizing toothpaste. As I mentioned, your enamel has three ions that exist in a solubility equilibrium in your saliva: calcium, phosphate, and hydroxide (replaced by fluoride). It makes sense, therefore, that just adding one of these ions is not enough if you want to actually strengthen your teeth. CariFree's toothpaste contains bioavailable sources of calcium and phosphate ions, allowing your tooth enamel to actually rebuild, rather than just dissolve at a lower rate.I hope this helps you all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great but I hate the cap
reviews.reviewText: This mouthwash is great hut the container design is not so great. They gray part of the cap kept coming apart from the white inner cap so I ended up just through the gray part of the cap away. I bought this again and the cap is still horrible

reviews.reviewText: Have been using it and it's great. The cap redesign is terrible. It's not the one pictured here, it's a grey one that is worse in every way. 1) no child safe feature 2) no longer comes with measuring cup 3) leaks more 4) wastes more plastic

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love love love this stuff!
reviews.reviewText: I think this is the best mouth rinse I’ve ever ever used. I haven’t had a chance to ask my dentist his thoughts about it yet, but in my opinion, it’s the best mouth rinse I’ve ever used!I have an issue with a dry mouth and it causes all sorts of issues if I don’t stay on top of it at all times! Unfortunately when I was younger I didn’t know what bad things could arise from having a dry mouth and leaving the symptoms to the hands of a busy, career-driven, young adult with places to go and things to do! And as a result, I had more fillings than I should have at that age (mid-30’s)!When I eventually learned, the hard way, about the dangers from leaving a dry mouth untreated, I began using all sorts of products. And I’ve found many that work and many that don’t work. But I’m not saying that this is the absolute best for treating a dry mouth. I believe it’s the best at preventing bad breath though, which is one of the side affects of having a dry mouth.So yes, buy this if you’re looking for a great-tasting rinse for prevention and/or treatment of bad breath! It only requires a minute of rinse and it (the mint) tastes sooooo delicious! You’ll want to use it many many times a day!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great mouthwash AND toothpaste!
reviews.reviewText: I always do extensive research when it comes to buying a health and beauty product. When I saw the review on this toothpaste I researched the website and reviews on and off of Amazon. I came across this product because my toddler has developed white spots on her teeth and I was not too excited about that.I originally bought the mint and used it on my toddler and myself. I love the mint. A little goes a long ways. It is a gel form but lathers well in the mouth. I have noticed when using this toothpaste that the amount of gunk I scrape off of my tongue after brushing is about 95% less than with normal toothpaste. That tells me that something is working in this toothpaste. Since using this toothpaste I have also received comments on my teeth. I have some sensitive spots when I floss and they are no longer sensitive after using this toothpaste.I ended up buying my daughter the grape flavor as it is more her flavor. She doesn’t mind the toothpaste. Her teeth are looking better, the white spots have started to minimize. I have no tried the grape flavor but another adult in my household has and they too like it and has said it lathers very well.I ended up buying the mint mouthwash as well. I was a bit hesitant at first because reviewers were saying it burned their mouth when using it and they refused to use it anymore. I happen to love the mouthwash. It does almost always burn my tongue but that is because of the damage I do to it myself from eating sour and salty foods. The mouthwash gives me an intense clean feeling. I use it every morning and night before bed.I also love the fact that these products do not contain acid (for shelf life) like most other brands do. Acid breaks down your enamel and that’s something you definitely want to avoid. I give his company a high five for that in itself!I’d recommend this toothpaste and the mouthwash to anyone looking for a great toothpaste that does as it says and contains no harmful ingredients. This company truly wants to protect your teeth and gums. I will co tongue to buy this for myself and my family.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023

reviews.reviewText: My hygienist recommended this rinse which I love. Tastes great! Way better than mouthwash!!
